excerpts: I suddenly had a craving for Spaghetti with Meatballs and stumbled upon this restaurant while walking.
I came in and took a look at the menu, then placed an order for Spaghetti with Meatballs and a side of French Fries.
That bowl of spaghetti is delicious with the sauce.
The meatballs I had requested to add in is so good, the meat is tender and juicy.
Plus the French Fries were fried to a perfect crispy texture.
This is truly a wonderful and delicious meal.
Very simple and the portion sizes are good enough to keep me filled for the afternoon.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Bennett W.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
This restaurant is awesome and it's always nice to have a spaghetti place nearby.

I suddenly had a craving for Spaghetti with Meatballs and stumbled upon this restaurant while walking.

I came in and took a look at the menu, then placed an order for Spaghetti with Meatballs and a side of French Fries. That bowl of spaghetti is delicious with the sauce. The meatballs I had requested to add in is so good, the meat is tender and juicy. Plus the French Fries were fried to a perfect crispy texture. This is truly a wonderful and delicious meal. Very simple and the portion sizes are good enough to keep me filled for the afternoon. This is certainly the best lunch meal I have had.

If dining with a large group (10 or more) making a reservation is highly recommended.

The food is delicious, friendly staff and good service. Overall, positive experience here.

excerpts: I ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and my boyfriend ordered the buccatini alfredo!
Both were very good and hit the spot.
I also LOVED their bread along with the vinegar.
The ambiance is quirky and the waitresses are very energetic!!
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Mauricia L.
spaghetti with meatballs.review: MMMMM YUMMY! I love all kinds of pasta and Emmy's spaghetti shack did not disappoint. I ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and my boyfriend ordered the buccatini alfredo! Both were very good and hit the spot. I also LOVED their bread along with the vinegar. The ambiance is quirky and the waitresses are very energetic!!

excerpts: The spaghetti with meatballs was drowning in sauce, while the pappardelle with butternut squash and spicy Italian sausage lacked flavor.

I have pretty high standards having lived in NY for 12 years, where they take Italian food seriously (both Italian American as well as regional Italian), and no self respecting Italian place would have overcooked the pasta so much.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Dave R.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
I was really hoping to like this spot, give how kitschy it is and the strong reviews, but it fell short. The service was friendly, albeit slow. Folks that were seated about 25 minutes after us received their entrees at the exact same time. 

The real issue was the quality of the food and drinks. My partners margarita was lacking flavor, and the garlic cheesy bread was overloaded with garlic...it lacked a balance of butter, cheese and garlic.  Even worse, neither of the pasta dishes was al dente. The spaghetti with meatballs was drowning in sauce, while the pappardelle with butternut squash and spicy Italian sausage lacked flavor. I have pretty high standards having lived in NY for 12 years, where they take Italian food seriously (both Italian American as well as regional Italian), and no self respecting Italian place would have overcooked the pasta so much.

excerpts: Highly recommend getting the spaghetti with meatballs along with the pear mule or the drinks they serve in the boot.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Khan N.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
Atmosphere:
My first overall impression was that the whole restaurant itself had a unique and fun atmosphere. The walls be furniture are a mix of a thrift shop with a Spencer's store from the mall.

Food:
First off the custom menus are awesome with tiny doodles of the food. We ordered the spaghetti and meatballs ( the highlight of the meal) and the Orecchiette. Both of the dishes were on the more salty side but the orecchiette was defiantly really salty and the flavors did not mesh well. Highly recommend getting the spaghetti with meatballs along with the pear mule or the drinks they serve in the boot.

Service: 
It seems that all the waiters here are in a bbad mood. From the time we got seated to when we left it seems that smiles were rare here. I didn't mind this so much but it would have been nice to have a happy atmosphere so we can enjoy our food that much more. The only exception to this is the bartenders are friendly and seem to be in higher spirits then the rest of the staff.

Overall:
I would recommend going here and sticking with the classics. It has a fun decor with some arcade machines in the back. The bathrooms are clean and the food is exceptional.

excerpts: - spaghetti with meatballs:
I know they're famous for this dish, but I think my expectations were much higher.
The spaghetti was good, the meatballs fell apart, it was tasty, but it really didn't stand out.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Ke C.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
Delicious! Their menu is pretty crazy, and the atmosphere is kind of divey, but has quality service and food. I came here with my coworkers, and we ordered a whole unofficial tasting menu. 

Appetizers:
- Mozzarella balls: absolutely delicious. I don't normally like mozzarella, but these were perfection, fried with the texture of a tater tot and savory. 
- shrimp ceviche: kind of out of place, and the shrimp was cooked, but it was top notch! Really refreshing and punchy with flavor. Even the from a guy who makes his own ceviche loved it. 
- garlic bread: this was alright. It was slices of toast, with pretty raw minced garlic and cilantro all over it. WARNING: this will give you garlic breath for a couple days at least. No exaggeration. 

Main dishes:
- Bucatini with mushroom and leek: this was one of my favorites. The bucatini is like a short spaghetti straw (it literally has a tunnel/hole through it!). It was really creamy, and the mushroom and leek offered it awesome mix of texture and subtle flavors.
- Fall pappardelle: this one was just okay. By the time I got to this dish, the pasta was cooled and stuck together in an unappetizing mass, and I remembered it tasting slightly bitter 
- Zoodles: SO GOOD. I am a converted zoodle fanatic now. Everything about this dish was just perfect: the texture of the zoodles themselves (slightly crunchy), the fat juicy shrimp, and whatever sauce/seasoning they had complemented everything super well. 
- spaghetti with meatballs: I know they're famous for this dish, but I think my expectations were much higher. The spaghetti was good, the meatballs fell apart, it was tasty, but it really didn't stand out.

excerpts: The star of the show here is spaghetti with meatballs.
I came with two friends: they both had spaghetti with meatballs, and I had pappardelle with pulled pork.
Everything was great, but I'm getting the meatballs next time!
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Aviah M.
spaghetti with meatballs.review: Really fun place! It all starts with uber-cute menus, in handwritten style. The star of the show here is spaghetti with meatballs. I came with two friends: they both had spaghetti with meatballs, and I had pappardelle with pulled pork. Everything was great, but I'm getting the meatballs next time! We also got a bottle of vino verde as well as a delicious "OMG PB Bar" dessert. I will definitely be back here.

excerpts:
Homemade spaghetti with meatballs the size of a tennis ball! 
So flavorful and YUMMY!!!
Even though the wait was long, it was sure worth it!
We also ordered a bottle of sangria, Stuffed jalapeño peppers and for dessert the OMG Peanut butter bar! 
EVERYTHING is DELICOUS!!! 
Our waitress was awesome also!!!
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Remie M.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
OHHH MY HOLY MEATBALLS!

WOW!!! 

This place is small and FULL.  Apparently, everyone knows abt this place.
The night before we were just chillin' at my brothers place watching "24hours of gluttony" these two Asian guys eating at 24 places in 24 hours.  The episode we watched was of course the SF.  I saw they stopped by this place, and HAD to come here and check out the meatballs!
Boy, was I amazed! Homemade spaghetti with meatballs the size of a tennis ball! So flavorful and YUMMY!!!
Even though the wait was long, it was sure worth it!
We also ordered a bottle of sangria, Stuffed jalapeño peppers and for dessert the OMG Peanut butter bar! 
EVERYTHING is DELICOUS!!! 
Our waitress was awesome also!!!

excerpts: We decided on the spaghetti with meatballs and one order was certainly enough for two.
As we remember it it arrived largely portioned, with hot, massive meatballs and a tangy sauce.
S & MB isn't a particularly inspiring dish but it did its job.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Esther A.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
Last time I've been to Emmy's was probably around 2011 but decided to give them another go as take out this time. We decided on the spaghetti with meatballs and one order was certainly enough for two. As we remember it it arrived largely portioned, with hot, massive meatballs and a tangy sauce. S & MB isn't a particularly inspiring dish but it did its job. Should have gone for the garlic bread but decided against it since we were indulging in carbs with the spaghetti alone. 

There are other pasta dishes that look tantalizing (Rasta Pasta!). I guess Emmy's back on the rotation!

excerpts: We had the spaghetti with meatballs and it was very good.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: D L.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
Really nice laid back place. The waitresses are really friendly and nice. We had the spaghetti with meatballs and it was very good. Hot too.

They don't serve iced tea, it would be nice if they would. We don't drink alcohol, but otherwise everything else was very nice.

excerpts: We ordered the prawn ceviche and a spaghetti with meatballs to share.
Be advised, the portions are large.
The ceviche was very good, a perfect balance of heat and tanginess.
But taste buds were salivating as a I ate.
Then came the spaghetti with meatballs next, which is hard not to like.
On the dish was three giant meatballs surrounding the pasta with marinara sauce.
Not overly sauced, delicious and warming.
Thanks for this great dinner.
I will return.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Loi L.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
I've been here several times and I'm finally writing down my opinion.  I came here recently with my girlfriend for dinner.  There was a line, but I made same day reservations through their online system.  It was very easy process and we didn't have to wait more than 5 minutes before getting seated.  That's a plus for their system.

We ordered the prawn ceviche and a spaghetti with meatballs to share.  Be advised, the portions are large.  The ceviche was very good, a perfect balance of heat and tanginess.  But taste buds were salivating as a I ate.  Then came the spaghetti with meatballs next, which is hard not to like.  On the dish was three giant meatballs surrounding the pasta with marinara sauce.  Not overly sauced, delicious and warming.  Thanks for this great dinner.  I will return.

excerpts: I usually get the spaghetti with meatballs.
It is great every time.
They have a nice drink menu as well.
Good place to take kids.
Just a heads up, parking can be a little challenging on fri-sat nights.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Peter R.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
This place is great! The service is usually prompt and attentive. The food is consistently good. I usually get the spaghetti with meatballs. It is great every time. They have a nice drink menu as well. Good place to take kids. 
Just a heads up, parking can be a little challenging on fri-sat nights.

excerpts: Ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and the caesar salad.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Ruchi P.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
The ambiance - eclectic cool old school - pretty casual - I like!

The food - could use a little more flavor, but good enough to come back.  Ordered the spaghetti with meatballs and the caesar salad.

The service - Ryan really let us down.  We were excited about the yummy free bread and kindly asked him for some.  He said they are most likely out, but that he would ask the kitchen.  He said they had none so we ordered garlic bread (which we didn't love).  On our way out we noticed two boxes of the free bread (in separate places) half full.  I mean seriously......

This is my first complain about service review - but that's bc it directly affected my food intake.  Don't mess with yummy!

excerpts: Ordered the peach caprese salad, shack caesar, spaghetti with meatballs and risotto.
All the dishes were great.
The meatballs were really moist and had great flavor.
I love the down to earth vibe here.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Chi N.
spaghetti with meatballs.review: Ordered the peach caprese salad, shack caesar, spaghetti with meatballs and risotto. All the dishes were great. The meatballs were really moist and had great flavor. I love the down to earth vibe here.

excerpts: Excellent pasta dishes, the Spaghetti with meatballs isn't the "best" in the city
but it's effing delicious
and that's good enough for me.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: DJ P.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
I love this place and I'm not just saying that because it's in my neighborhood. It's worth coming back to again and again. (There's so many options on the menu to choose from!)

Excellent pasta dishes, the Spaghetti with meatballs isn't the "best" in the city but it's effing delicious and that's good enough for me. Plenty of great starter dishes and the servers are super friendly and cool.

The vibe is casual (yet charming) and it's a fun place to take a friend (or date) to hang out and catch up.

excerpts: My husband got the spaghetti with meatballs and he was happy with his dish.
I got the habanero risotto with rock shrimp.
It was out of this world delicious.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Az A.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
Love the old location. This was my first time to the new place. 
My husband and I went in around 7pm on Sunday night. We were quoted 20 min wait for a table so we grabbed a seat at the bar until our table was ready. My husband ordered a "personal carafe" of wine that came out of a barrel. I don't remember what it was called. The bartender suggested it. It was acceptable. A bit boring and had a faint hint nutmeg or something. I find it a bit odd that they don't carry any Cabernet. I ordered a 40 of Mickeys :-). 
We were seated pretty quickly. We ordered the garlic bread to share. My husband got the spaghetti with meatballs and he was happy with his dish. I got the habanero risotto with rock shrimp. It was out of this world delicious. I'd suggest not eating the actual habanero that garnishes the dish cause it's hot as f@¢&.

The portions are huge. Ordering an appetizer and an entree to share is totally enough food for 2 people.

excerpts: I have had the meatball sandwich and Spaghetti with meatballs, both are super tasty.
The Orecchiette was rich and full of flavor with pancetta and asparagus.
YUMMMMM.
They moved to a new location and its roomier but still has the same cool feel.
ALSO - they have a photo booth in back by the bathrooms!!
That is super fun!
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Jennifer T.
spaghetti with meatballs.review: I've been here a few times and I've been pleased with my experience every time.  I have had the meatball sandwich and Spaghetti with meatballs, both are super tasty.  The Orecchiette was rich and full of flavor with pancetta and asparagus.  YUMMMMM.  They moved to a new location and its roomier but still has the same cool feel.  ALSO - they have a photo booth in back by the bathrooms!!  That is super fun!

excerpts: After looking at the menu, I settled on the spaghetti with meatballs since my friend was raving about them.
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Richard C.
spaghetti with meatballs.review:
After my friend told me how good the spaghetti and meatballs were at this place, I decided I had to give it a try. So, I came here with said friend on a Sunday night. When we got there, we were told that there is a 15 minute wait and we were fine with that and the hostess told us that we could sit at the counter and order drinks while we waited. We waited for a bit, probably about 10 minutes and we were told that our table was ready. We got seated in a booth and given our menus.

After looking at the menu, I settled on the spaghetti with meatballs since my friend was raving about them. He, himself, got the orecchiette with pancetta and got garlic bread for starters.

The garlic bread left a lot to be desired, it had some garlic spread but not nearly enough and was hardly salted at all. My friend got his orecchiette before I got my spaghetti (i.e. they didn't come at the same time) and I don't really find that to be a big deal but I know it's bad serving etiquette.

My spaghetti and meatballs were okay for a little bit but the more I ate it, the more I disliked it. I think the problem came from the fact that it was fresh tomato sauce and so it was VERY acidic with each bite. I ended up having to resort to eating a remaining slice of garlic bread to cut some of the acid. The meatballs themselves were okay, it felt like they used too much filler and so it didn't taste as meaty as I imagined it should have been. Quite honestly, I struggled to finish the plate and I ended up having to get help from my friend.

My friend complained about how salty his orecchiette was but I didn't try it so I can't say from personal experience but I trust his judgement. During our entire meal, we didn't get checked in on once. It wasn't like the place was super busy and it wasn't that we needed anything in particular, but it's one of those things that we felt like that we weren't welcomed; it's a bit difficult to describe that feeling because it's not like they did anything in particular (really a more lack thereof) to make us feel that way.

Over all, I can't say I look forward to coming back. It's one of those places that I feel like that I would come back if someone wanted to come but it would not be a place I would suggest going to. The food wasn't pleasing, the service was pretty non-existent and kids were running around like they owned the place (I know, it's not the place's fault but it's not Chuck-E-Cheese either). Can't say I hate the place but I can't say I like it either.

excerpts: Must try: Spaghetti with meatballs and caesar salad
spaghetti with meatballs.author: Lyna K.
spaghetti with meatballs.review: Must try: Spaghetti with meatballs and caesar salad

excerpts: We also got a bottle of vino verde as well as a delicious "OMG PB Bar" dessert.
I will definitely be back here.
omg pb bar.author: Aviah M.
omg pb bar.review: Really fun place! It all starts with uber-cute menus, in handwritten style. The star of the show here is spaghetti with meatballs. I came with two friends: they both had spaghetti with meatballs, and I had pappardelle with pulled pork. Everything was great, but I'm getting the meatballs next time! We also got a bottle of vino verde as well as a delicious "OMG PB Bar" dessert. I will definitely be back here.
